title: Strong
lyrics:
[intro]
(D)  (G)  (Em)  (A)
(D)Aaaah  (E7)aaah  (G)aaah  (A)aaah
 
(D)My breath smells of a thousand fags
And (G)when I'm drunk I dance like me Dad
I've (Em7)started to dress a bit like (A)him
 
And (D)early morning when I wake up
I (G)look like Kiss but without the make-up
And (Em7)that's a good line to take it to the bridge (A)
 
[pre-chorus]
(Em) And you know and you know
Cos my (Bm)life's a mess
(Em) And I'm trying to grow so be(A)fore I'm old I'll confess
 
[chorus]
(D)You think that I'm (E7)strong
You're (G)wrong, you're (A)wrong
(D)I'll sing my (E7)song
My (G)song my (A)song
 
(D)My bed's full of takeaways
And (G)fantasies of easy lays
The (Em7)pause button's broke on my video (A)
 
And (D)is this real cos I feel fake
(G)Oprah Winfrey Ricki Lake
(Em7)Teach me things I don't need to know (A)
 
[pre-chorus]
(Em) And you know and you know
Cos my (Bm)life's a mess
(Em) And I'm trying to grow so be(A)fore I'm old I'll confess
 
[chorus]
(D)You think that I'm (E7)strong
You're (G)wrong, you're (A)wrong
(D)I'll sing my (E7)song
My (G)song my (A)song
 
[bridge]
If I (Am)did it all again I'd be a nun
The (G)rain was never cold when I was young
I'm still (Em)young we're still (B)young
(Am)Life's too short to be afraid
(G)Step in(Em7)side the (D)sun (E7)  (G)  (A)
 
[interlude] (D)  (E7)  (G)  (A)
 
[pre-chorus]
(Em) And you know and you know
Cos my (Bm)life's a mess
(Em) And I'm trying to grow (Bb)aaaah (A)yeah-yeah
 
[chorus]
(D)You think that I'm (E7)strong
You're (G)wrong, you're (A)wrong
(D)I'll sing my (E7)song
My (G)song my (A)song
 
[chorus again, with “yeah-yeah”]
(D)You think that I'm (E7)strong
You're (G)wrong, you're (A)wrong
(D)I'll sing my (E7)song
My (G)song my (A)song
 
[outro: chorus again with “yeah-yeah” and outro lyrics]
(D)Life's too short to be afraid, so (E7)take a pill to numb the pain
(G)You don't have to take the blame (A)
(D)Life's too short to be afraid, so (E7)take a pill to numb the pain
(G)You don't have to take the blame (A)
(D-single strum) [end]
